content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

```julia
struct FloatWithUnits{T<:Real}
    value::T
    unit::String
end

Base.show(io::IO, x::FloatWithUnits) = print(io, x.value, " ", x.unit)
```
This code defines a new type `FloatWithUnits` with two fields: `value` and `unit`. The `show` function is then defined to take an I/O stream (`io`) and an instance of `FloatWithUnits` (`x`). It will print the value and unit separated by a space.
